info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 15 at 5:38AM ChST until October 15 at 7:30AM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
info.description:
FFWGUM
The National Weather Service in Tiyan has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Guam...
* Until 730 AM ChST.
* At 538 AM ChST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the past 2 hours and additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are possible across Guam in the next 1 to 2 hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, and streets as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Guam, especially in poor drainage areas and areas near rivers or streams.
Steeper terrain could be prone to mudslides in these heavier rains.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded or blocked roads.
Report flooding or blocked roads to law enforcement.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
